title: Access blocked to website
content:
I am trying to access the website of the Dutch tax office, but am blocked (see attached picture) Only 10 days ago, this was not a problem and I could freely access the website.

I've also tried with other browsers (MS Edge) and a MacBook laptop (Firefox), and I do not get that problem, only with my Windows desktop/Firefox combination.
creator: rencsandor

title: Literally without the ability to use different profiles normally like Chrome does, i don't see myself and many other people switching to Firefox
content:
Problem described like in this question: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1262935

There is just no way to comfortably have like 2 seperate profiles open in Firefox at ALL. It's one of the key things how i keep my work and private tabs seperated, i can't go without it anymore. But i want to do the switch to Firefox SO BAD but without this feature i don't see it happening at all. I don't want to enter some obscure internal page and then only have one open but not the other. I want to be met with a lil pop up of which profile i wanna open, click, boom, got it open no problem! Is it really that hard!! it's been YEARS, Firefox :sob: I could really cry man, thanks for listening.
creator: weltraumimport

title: Connanor find primary firefox account
content:
Hi Guys thank you for your time and effort that you voluntary offer to support Mozilla Firefox. I have been a lifelong user of Firefox. I have during this process lost 4 x laptops (over a span of 20 years) - reformatted the current one twice. My mistake - I neglected to backup Firefox.

I cannot and do remember what my primary Firefox account was. Their are bookmarks and saved passwords on it that I desperately need. Can you please help what what to do?

I have subscribed to new a [edited] @gmail.com primary account to to use Firefox again. I help with serial numbers, brand of the laptops that I have used in the past.

If you can help, please please help.

Warm South African Regards Pierre Wepener [address removed from public forum] RSA ID no: [removed from public forum] Contact nr: [removed from public forum]
creator: wepener.ame

title: nefunkční načtení stránek

Dnes jsem potřeboval něco platit kartou online a také mě to nešlo. Platební brána se načetla ale po zadání údajů nereaguje. Musel jsem použít GoogleChrome ve kterém to jde bez potíží.

creator: jbuss1

title: Firefox freeze on Nvidia Jetson Xavier NX
content: Summary : UI Freeze issue in Firefox version greater than 100 Behaviour: Screen becomes unresponsive We have an angular 13 web application running in kiosk mode in Firefox using command This UI unresponsive when no interaction with the screen for long hrs and sometime it is crashing while it is getting used. We are seeing this issue in all the Firefox versions deployed in our systems that are all version 100 or above. We do not see this issue in the same base device OS and resources with version 100 and below.System Details : Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS, aarch64 GNU/Linux Hardware: Jetson Xavier NX RAM : 8 GB CPU : 6 cores  The way we solve this issue today is by relaunching Firefox. Just by closing and opening the browser makes the UI is responsive again.
creator: jebaraj.selvapeter

title: Bookmarks tab in Menu Bar
content: I've seen this question asked in other ways but the answer never seems to be a solution to my issue. I just bought a new computer, Windows 11. I downloaded Firefox, I have the menu bar active at the top of the Firefox browser so I'm seeing, FILE EDIT HISTORY BOOKMARKS TOOLS HELP. If I bookmark a webpage, in the past I was always able to left click on BOOKMARKS and a drop down list of all my bookmarks would appear. Now, that is not happening. THIS IS THE REASON I USE FIREFOX! Chrome and Edge both make it a pain in the neck to access bookmarks. I want this ability back, why aren't my bookmarks showing up when I left click on bookmarks like it always has?
creator: bsmith100

title: Qustodio Causing Firefox to Crash
content: Hello, I recently had Qustodio installed on my Acer laptop. I want to keep it on, but ever since I installed it, every time Firefox is opened it stays up for anywhere between 20 seconds to 2 minutes, before force closing. No errors are given. For clarity, I am not the parent and do not have parental access, but I have worked with the person who does have access and they receive no reports of any problems. I am also on Windows 10. Qustodio has been a great service, but after reaching out to their team they haven't been able to find a solution either. Other browsers such as Brave also force close within the same time window. I haven't tried any others besides Microsoft Edge, which is the only browser that works. God would I hate to use that. Services such as Steam and Discord have had no issues. I've extensively searched to make sure I had no add-ons, external services/anti spywares, or settings that might cause this - including setting about:config>root>security preferences to true - and have refreshed/reinstalled countless times, yet still the browser crashes. I can and am currently using Firefox just fine on my iPhone, so it does not appear to be a network error. Would anyone be able to help? Having 0 error reports makes this much more difficult to troubleshoot. After doing some searching, it seems no one else has reported this being an issue. Thank you. The search engine I use on both iPhone and laptop is Google.
creator: ethandf03
